results.title: Awakenings
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Walter Parkes, Lawrence Lasker and Penny Marshall
results.brief_description: Robin Williams plays Dr Malcolm Sayer, a researcher recently appointed to a clinical position in a hospital for chronically ill patients. Amongst his patients are victims of a Sleeping Sickness Epidemic, unble to communicate with the outside world. Making a connection between this illness and Parkinson’s disease, he begins to experiment with a promising new drug. Robert De Niro plays Leonard Lowe, the first patient awakened by the drug, whose marked improvement prompts the hospital board to expand the benefits to other patients. As patients begin to engage in life again and confront the radical changes in themselves and their world, Dr Sayer deals with the emerging side effects. Based upon the book by neurologist Dr Oliver Sacks, who recounted his work with post-encephalitic patients afflicted with ‘Sleeping Sickness’ and his experimental treatment using L-Dopa. Cast also includes John Heard, Julie Kavner, Penelope Ann Miller and Max von Sydow. Screenplay by Steven Zaillian.

results.title: Avoiding danger
results.creator_credit: National Association of Citizens Advice Bureau and Paul White
results.brief_description: In July 1986 Estate Agent, Suzy Lamplugh, disappeared while on a client appointment. The Suzy Lamplugh Trust was set up to encourage increased awareness among employers and staff of the potential danger from attack in the workplace. The Trust is engaged in comprehensive research in the field of personal vulnerability, and is developing courses to promote greater understanding of the ways to minimise risk. There are practical steps that everyone can take. First, AVOID potential risk by following cautionary procedures. TALK in ways that will placate rather than provoke customers or clients who are aggressive. WALK away from danger. DEFEND yourself if all other methods fail.

results.title: Avocets return
results.creator_credit: RSPB Film and Video Unit, Anthony Bomford and Anthony Clay
results.brief_description: This film shows how the Avocet has returned to Britain, as a breeding bird, after a lapse of 100 years. Filmed in Suffolk and Cornwall, it traces the natural history of the Avocet, and the success of the Royal Society for the Protection of Birds in protecting rare species.

results.title: Avant-garde
results.creator_credit: Luis Bunuel, Salvador Dali, Rene Clair and Jean Vigo
results.brief_description: A collection of three classic, silent avant-garde films. Bunuel and Dali’s surrealist nightmare “Un Chien Andalou” (1929) which caused a riot at its Paris premiere. Rene Clair’s dada-surrealist classic “Entr’acte” (1924) in which inanimate objects start to have a will of their own. Made in collaboration with Man Ray, Marcel Duchamp and Francis Picarbia. Jean Vigos’ “A Propos de Nice” which is a fascinating study in contrasts between the tourists and sunseekers of the wealthy section of Nice and the toilers of the poor sections of the old town. A carnival in the latter part of the film emerges as a kind of dance of death.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Luis Bunuel, Salvador Dali, Rene Clair and Jean Vigo

results.title: Avalon: the 1992 Australian International Air Show
results.creator_credit: Apocalypse, Aerospace Foundation, Airshows Downunder, Neil Brown, Cathie Scott and Geoff Tanner
results.brief_description: In October 1992 the largest gathering of aircraft in Australia took place at Avalon Airport, Victoria. The five day air show was the biggest ever held in the Southern Hemisphere. A complete range of aircraft operated by the Australian Defence Forces, general aviation aircraft, warbirds, recreational and sport aircraft, airliners, antiques, balloons, radio-controlled models, hang-gliders and helicopters have all been recorded in static or spectacular flying displays on this video. Presented by Jeff Watson.

results.title: Avalon
results.creator_credit: Bandai Visual Company, Media Factory, DENTSU, Nippon Herald Films, Atsushi Kubo and Mamoru Oshii
results.brief_description: In a future world, young people, disheartened by their bleak reality, are increasingly becoming addicted to an illegal (and potentially deadly) battle simulation game called Avalon. Ash (Malgorzata Foremniak) is a ruthless “Class A” fighter and reigning queen of the games who suspects a conspiracy at play and decides to face-off the ruthless programmers. Using highly stylized computer graphics, director Mamoru Oshii (Ghost in the shell), presents an exhilarating psychological science-fiction thriller, that, with its dystopian setting, has the hallucinatory logic of a disturbing, if atmospheric, computer game.

results.title: Avalanche (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Filmed on location in the Austrian Tyrol, AVALANCHE is an action packed tale of adventure on a snow holiday. Despite strict regulations imposed by their teacher, two boys set out to climb the mountain. Disaster and gripping drama follow. Rated: G
